nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.title: Arriving at the Meeting
nodes.text: A neutral room, two chairs, and a table with water glasses. You and your co-parent sit across from each other, with the mediator between you.

choices.label: Start by thanking them for coming.
choices.text: You take a breath and say: “Thanks for being here. I know this isn’t easy for either of us.”

choices.label: Jump straight into the problem.
choices.text: You lean forward: “We need to talk about pickups and drop-offs because this can’t keep going like it has.”

nodes.speaker: Mediator
nodes.title: Naming the Goal
nodes.text: The mediator nods and summarizes: “It sounds like both of you want less chaos around hand-overs and more predictability for your child.”

choices.label: Agree and focus on the child’s needs.
choices.text: You say: “Yes. I want her to feel safe and know what to expect.”

choices.label: Bring up how exhausted you are.
choices.text: You sigh: “I’m exhausted. I’m always the one adjusting last-minute.”

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.title: First Small Agreement
nodes.text: By the end of the meeting, you’ve drafted a simple agreement: fixed pickup times, a shared calendar, and a rule that changes are requested at least 24 hours ahead whenever possible.

choices.label: Save this agreement and return to menu.
choices.text: You mentally file this as a first step, not a magic fix.
